title: Roma want meeting with Manchester United 'to discuss permanent move for Chris Smalling'
text:
Roma reportedly want to open talks with Manchester United over the possibility of signing on-loan defender Chris Smalling permanently after an impressive spell so far.

Smalling found himself cast out at Old Trafford, with his manager Ole Gunnar Solskjaer preferring Harry Maguire and Victor Lindelof at centre back.

He was subsequently shifted out to the Serie A giants on a loan deal until the end of the season, and has played five games so far.

Chris Smalling is said to have impressed Roma enough for them to open talks over a transfer

And the Rome outfit are satisfied with Smalling's displays enough to want to open discussions with his parent club over a transfer, according to The Mirror.

It is thought that the two clubs were set for a meeting on Friday to discuss the former Fulham defender's future.

The club are in need of defensive bodies as they compete for a top-four spot in Italy's top flight, with three wins from eight games and just one defeat.

The former Fulham centre back found himself surplus to requirements at Old Trafford

Smalling has helped shore up Roma's defence as the team have conceded 10 league goals so far, with the England international keeping two clean sheets.

He very nearly had a third before a contentious decision in the Europa League on Thursday that saw a penalty given against him in the 94th minute, despite the ball looking to have hit him in the face.

Lars Stindl slotted home the resulting spot-kick to secure a 1-1 draw, leaving Smalling in 'disbelief' at the decision.

The centre-back tries to see the funny side of the controversial handball given against him
description: It is thought that Manchester United and Roma were set for a meeting on Friday to discuss the former Fulham defender's future after he  impressed for the Italian outfit over his five games.
